thread.title: US stocks flat as Lockheed Martin seals Sikorsky deal
thread.title_full: US stocks flat as Lockheed Martin seals Sikorsky deal

title: US stocks flat as Lockheed Martin seals Sikorsky deal
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Jul 20, 2015, 15:35 BST - UK Markets close in 55 mins. US stocks flat as Lockheed Martin seals Sikorsky deal AFP â€“ 6 minutes ago View Photo 

US stocks were little changed in early trade Monday following solid earnings from Morgan Stanley (Xetra: 885836 - news ) and Lockheed Martin's purchase of Sikorsky Aircraft from United Technologies for $9 billion. 
About 30 minutes into trade, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was at 18,071.88, down 14.57 points (0.08 percent). 
The broad-based S&P 500 shed 2.32 (0.11 percent) to 2,124.32, while the tech-rich Nasdaq Composite Index advanced 2.59 (0.05 percent) to 5,212.73. 
Lockheed Martin rose 1.4 percent as it announced the addition of Sikorsky to its portfolio of aerospace and defense products. Dow member United Technologies dropped 0.6 percent. 
Morgan Stanley shares were even as second-quarter earnings of 79 cents per share bested analyst expectations by five cents behind robust merger and acquisition advisory income. 
Oil-services giant Halliburton rose 1.4 percent after reporting second-quarter earnings of 44 cents per share, better than the 29 cents that analysts projected. Net earnings, however, were just $54 million due to the petroleum industry downturn, down from $774 million a year ago. 
Toymaker Hasbro surged 5.4 percent on a 25 percent rise in second-quarter earnings to $41.8 million. Popular (NasdaqGS: BPOP - news ) products included games and other toys based around the "Jurassic World" movie and various Marvel superhero blockbusters. 
Rooftop solar company Vivint Solar (NYSE: VSLR - news ) surged 45.2 percent on news it will be acquired by SunEdison (NYSE: SUNE - news ) for $2.2 billion. SunEdison rose 5.3 percent. 
Biopharmaceutical company Exelixis (NasdaqGS: EXEL - news ) bolted 46.6 percent higher after disclosing positive results from a clinical trial for a new drug to treat metastatic renal cell carcinoma. Exelixis plans to complete regulatory filings for the medication in early 2016. 
Online payments company PayPal rose 5.1 percent in its first day as a free-standing firm following its spinoff from eBay. EBay (Xetra: 916529 - news ) fell 0.9 percent. 
Bond prices fell. The yield on the 10-year US Treasury rose to 2.39 percent from 2.35 percent Friday, while the 30-year advanced to 3.12 percent from 3.08 percent. Bond prices and yields move inversely.
